author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Railway Budget has evoked mixed response from the trade and industry and the travelling public.

The Confederation of Indian Industry Salem has hailed the budget. In a statement, K.M.S. Rajesh Kumar, Chairman, CII Salem district said that the budget has a lot of positives like increased capital expenditure, the first Railway Hub at Chennai, beautification of Nagapatinam Railway Station and improving passenger amenities without increasing the passenger fares. However absence of any major projects to South India and Tamil Nadu, in particular, is very disappointing, he said.

The Tamil Nadu Small and Tiny Industries Association has welcomed various announcements. K. Mariappan, vice-president of the Tamil Nadu Small and Tiny Industries Association, said that the proposed corridors will minimise the logistics expenditure for transportation of goods and will also minimise the travelling time.

A.K.B. Krishnamurthy, vice-president, Salem Railway Users Forum, said that the budget has innovative proposals. M.P. Velusamy, president and K. Murugan, Member of the Mohanur Rail Commuters Welfare Association, thanked the Railway Minister for not hiking the passenger ticket fare. S. Sivakumar, president of Guides Association, Attur, welcomed the allotment of additional berths for senior citizens and women, introduction of insurance policy for the willing passengers, introduction of Antyodaya Express, etc.
title: Mixed response to proposals
